overview:
With more than a decade of experience shepherding technology-driven companies from inception through high-profile acquisitions and successive adoption and growth cycles, Lance is a well-known innovator noted for his work in the areas of digital media, content delivery, and wireless technologies.

His record of achievement is evidenced by seminal contributions to the advancement of video processing, optimization and delivery technologies to affect significant cost savings for high concurrency storage systems.

Consequently, he regularly speaks at national and international events including NAB, CES and Digital Hollywood, CDSA, HEW Summit, and PEVE.

Lance is the former CTO for Technicolor’s digital supply chain platform for content ingestion, hosting, security, delivery and consumer fulfillment. He is also an inaugural member of the Thomson Technicolor fellowship program in recognition of his contributions to the company’s intellectual property portfolio and ongoing innovation.

He parlayed this position through pivotal work as the co-founder and CEO of SyncCast, where the technologies and services developed under his guidance powered the digital offerings of distinguished companies including Microsoft, Billboard, Warner Music Group, The Motion Picture Association of America, Lionsgate Entertainment, NBC Universal, EMI Music Group and DIRECTV.

The role Lance played at SyncCast in launching Microsoft’s Xbox Video Market Place brought the end-to-end electronic fulfillment assets of the company to bear as Xbox captured the second highest market share in the video download space over the course of a few short months. This success subsequently caught the attention of Technicolor which acquired SyncCast in 2007.

Lance’s career in advanced media technology began at venture-funded Voxel where he served as the director of technology. Subsequent to Voxel, Lance founded WareNet Inc., an early SaaS leader in outsourced infrastructure.
